intro: Micranthes aequidentata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, densely packed flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white to pale blue, and they bloom in late summer to early fall. Micranthes aequidentata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
